tika.dc.description:
Ahhh, remember sleep? Now that you are pregnant or a new mom, getting some shut-eye may not be as simple as it used to be. From surging hormones to crying babies, sleep disturbances go hand in hand with motherhood. Now, in Sleep Deprived No More, Dr. Jodi Mindell gives you the lowdown on solving sleep problems and staying alert throughout your pregnancy and the first six months after your baby arrives. This accessible guide is full of quick tips and proven strategies so everyone in the family can get the sleep they need. Learn the secrets to: Determine how much sleep your body requires, Catch up on lost sleep, Find a comfortable sleep position, even with a bulging belly, Eliminate the common causes of sleep problems, such as leg cramps, bark pain, and frequent trips to the bathroom, Solve conditions like insomnia, restless legs syndrome, and sleep apnea, Deal with postpartum depression, Get energized and stay focused throughout the day, Handle nursing and nighttime feedings, Get your baby to sleep through the night. Whether you're exhausted from expecting your first, a sleep-deprived mom of multiples, or just ready to kick your husband out of bed for snoring, this all-in-one resource has everything you need to get some much-deserved rest.

About the Author:
Jodi A. Mindell, PHD, is the associate director of the Sleep Center at The Children's Hospital of Philadelphia and professor of psychology at Saint Joseph's University
